text: have you ever felt someone disrespecting
you but in a subtle way sometimes
disrespect appears in sneaky ways and it
can be very painful too in this video
we'll expose 14 sneaky acts of
disrespect so you can deal with them
confidently and ensure it never happens
again endless delays if someone always
keeps you waiting without any valid
reason it shows they don't value your
time if this happens calmly let them
know how you feel those who care about
you will respect you and make an effort
to change backhanded
compliments do they compliment you in
ways that feel insulting for example
you're really spart for someone who
didn't attend college the truth is
backhanded compliments are impolite
genuine compliments should make you feel
happy not confused or
offended silent
treatment do they suddenly stop talking
to you ignore you and shut down
communication psychologists consider
this a form of abuse people might do it
to control or manipulate others this
prevents issues from being resolved
causes misunderstandings and destroys
trust let them know that silent
treatment is unacceptable healthy
relationships need communication even
when we're upset toxic teasing do they
often mock you and try to pass it off as
a joke it's a subtle form of disrespect
however in instead of retaliating
discuss how it makes you feel honest
communication can help people see how
their words hurt and Inspire change
phone
distractions when someone is always on
their phone while you talk it shows
they're not fully present and don't
value the
conversation experts say that the mere
presence of a smartphone while two
people Converse makes Focus harder due
to expecting interruptions to fix this
kindly ask them to put their phone away
or talk when they can give their full
attention
dismissing your input being dismissed
can trigger similar neurological
responses as physical pain if your ideas
or suggestions are consistently
overlooked or disregarded it indicates a
lack of respect for your feelings and
contributions and it can erode your
confidence and self-esteem true respect
means valuing your feelings and
regarding your opinions as
necessary subtle
manipulation when someone ignores your
boundaries and tries to coerce or
guiltrip you into doing what you don't
want it shows they don't respect you
it's okay to say no to things you don't
want to do respectful people will
understand and honor your decision if
this video is helping you please give it
a thumbs up and subscribe for more
talking over you do they often interrupt
you while you're speaking it shows that
they don't value what you have to say
and that's a sign of disrespect so ask
them politely to let you finish before
they respond F credit theft do they take
credit for your ideas without your
permission that's a form of disrespect
your ideas are valuable and you deserve
credit for them speak up let others know
your contribution and make sure you get
the credit you deserve broken promises
research from the social science
research network shows that broken
promises can destroy trust if someone
doesn't keep their word and keeps
letting you down it shows a lack of
consideration for your trust and
feelings and that's a sign of
disrespect passion
mockery when someone makes fun of what
you love they invalidate what brings you
Joy and fulfillment in contrast people
who respect you will appreciate and
support your passions and
interests
gaslighting do they twist the truth and
make you doubt your own memory do they
make you take blame for their terrible
actions this Behavior can be emotionally
harmful if you suspect someone is gas
letting you know it's okay to ask a
mental Healthcare professional for
clarity and guidance to navigate this
challenging
situation gossip and secret betrayal do
they share your private information with
others when people talk about you behind
your back it's a breach of trust those
who respect you wouldn't gossip spread
rumors or share your confidential
information they will always respect
your privacy belittled achievements your
achievements big or small are worth
celebrating if someone makes them seem
unimportant it shows they don't value
your effort people who love and respect
you will celebrate your success sneaky
forms of disrespect can be hurtful but
now that you know the signs you're
better equipped to handle it the bottom
line is you have the right to walk away
communicate your feelings calmly set
boundaries and surround yourself with
people who love and respect you and
don't settle for anything less than the
respect you deserve want to learn more
